results.description: Sets the host where profiles are sent (the host running the Agent). Can be a hostname or an IP address. Ignored if `DD_TRACE_AGENT_URL` is set. Defaults to `localhost`.
Hostname or IP of your Datadog Agent.
Hostname or IP of your Datadog Agent.
Host of a running Datadog Agent.
Hostname or IP of your Datadog Agent.
Hostname where your Datadog Agent is running
Hostname or IP of your Datadog Agent.
The environment variable with your Datadog API key, in plaintext. **One** key environment variable is required.

Maximum size of the bodies to be processed in bytes. If set to `0`, the bodies are not processed. The recommended value is `10000000` (10MB). (To fully enable body processing, the `allow_mode_override` option should also be set in the External Processing filter configuration)
Maximum size of the bodies to be processed in bytes. If set to `0`, the bodies are not processed. (Recommended value: `10000000` (10MB))
Maximum size of bodies to process in bytes. If `0`, bodies are not processed. Recommended: `10000000` (10MB).

Maximum size of the bodies to be processed in bytes. If set to `0`, the bodies are not processed. The recommended value is `10485760` (10MB). (To fully enable body processing, the `allowModeOverride` option should also be set in the External Processing filter configuration.)

Maximum size of the bodies to be processed in bytes. If set to `0`, the bodies are not processed. The recommended value is `10000000` (10MB). (To fully enable body processing, the `allow_mode_override` option should also be set in the External Processing filter configuration)
Custom variable set by the Jenkins Datadog Plugin for trace IDs.
Sets the global `env` for all data emitted by the Agent. If `env` is not present in your trace data, this variable is used.
The [environment][3] name, for example, `production`. If not set, will be `unspecified-environment`
The [environment][13] name, for example, `production`.
The [environment][10] name, for example: `production`.
Sets the global tag `env` tag for all data emitted.
The [environment][5] name, for example, `production`.
The [environment][5] name, for example, `production`.
The [environment][4] name, for example, `production`.
The [environment][4] name, for example, `production`.
The [environment][4] name, for example, `production`.
If set to `true`, enables Allocation profiling (in Preview). Defaults to `false`.
Set to `true` to enable allocation profiling. It requires the profiler to be enabled already. Defaults to `false`.
If set to `true`, enables the .NET Profiler. Defaults to `false`.
If set to `true`, enables the profiler. Defaults to `false`.
If set to `true`, enables Live Heap profiling (in Preview). Defaults to `false`.

The [service][3] name, for example, `web-backend`. If this is not specified, the .NET Profiler tries to determine the service name automatically from the application name (process entry assembly or process name).
The [service][13] name, for example, `web-backend`.
The [service][10] name, for example, `web-backend`.

Destination Datadog site for your metrics, traces, and logs. Defaults to `datadoghq.com`.
Tags to apply to an uploaded profile. Must be a list of `<key>:<value>` separated by commas such as: `layer:api,team:intake`.
Tags to apply to an uploaded profile. Must be a list of `<key>:<value>` separated by commas such as: `layer:api,team:intake`.
Tags to apply to an uploaded profile. Must be a list of `<key>:<value>` separated by commas such as: `layer:api, team:intake`.
Host tags separated by spaces. For example: `simple-tag-0 tag-key-1:tag-value-1`.
List of tags. Attached in-app to every metric, event, log, trace, and service check emitted by this Agent.
Tags to apply to produced data. Must be a list of `<key>:<value>` separated by commas such as: `layer:api,team:intake`.

Sets the port where profiles are sent (the port where the Agent is listening for connections). Ignored if `DD_TRACE_AGENT_URL` is set. Defaults to`8126`.
Port of the Datadog Agent for trace collection.

Sets the URL endpoint where profiles are sent. Overrides `DD_AGENT_HOST` and `DD_TRACE_AGENT_PORT` if set. Defaults to `http://<DD_AGENT_HOST>:<DD_TRACE_AGENT_PORT>`.
Enables or disables debug logging (Could help in case of troubleshooting investigation). Valid values are: `true` or `false`. Defaults to `false`.
Enables trace collection. Defaults to `true`.

Set the logging level.
**Values**: `trace`, `debug`, `info`, `warn`, `error`, `critical`, `off`
Set the level for the [Datadog Agent log][8].
